name: MCC East Bay
mission: Join us in making a difference by donating today and helping us continue our vital work in serving the community.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://mcceastbay.org/zakat (Source: https://mcceastbay.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Limited match due to weaker results and/or higher uncertainty; review methodology details before deciding.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: ibn_sabil (+5); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 30/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish current reserve levels and a board-approved reserve policy (often 3-12 months for most nonprofits).
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

components.name: Theory of Change

components.evidence: Board governance: baseline (2 members, emerging org)
components.name: Governance

risks.risk_summary: Key concern: Board too small: 2 members

score_details.score_summary: Muslim Community Center - East Bay shows good alignment and limited impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://mcceastbay.org/zakat (Source: https://mcceastbay.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: The organization provides social services and maintains profile metadata under EIN 20-8085421.
The charity is zakat-eligible and follows specific asnaf categories for fund distribution.
Financial data and compensation information are reported via IRS filings.
The organization offers various giving methods and supports programs like the food pantry and car program.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization receives a GMG score of 40/100, reflecting a strong cultural and religious alignment for Muslim donors despite significant gaps in publicly verifiable financial data and impact reporting.
areas_for_improvement: Limited public availability of detailed impact metrics and third-party financial evaluations [1]
Low data confidence due to missing comprehensive financial reporting in standard databases [1][3]

dimension_explanations.alignment: The alignment score of 30/50 highlights a high donor fit for those seeking zakat-eligible causes and religious community building, though the overall track record is balanced by limited data transparency [2][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The impact score of 15/50 reflects a model of direct provision through programs like the food pantry, yet effectiveness is difficult to quantify due to a lack of cost-per-beneficiary data and third-party verification [1][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Muslim Community Center – East Bay serves as a vital hub for the emergence of an American Muslim identity through comprehensive social services and religious programming.
strengths: Maintains a transparent zakat policy with clear asnaf categories for distribution [2]
Provides direct social services including a food pantry and vehicle donation program [1][4]
baseline_narrative.summary: Based in Pleasanton, California, the Muslim Community Center – East Bay (MCC East Bay) provides essential community support through a dedicated food pantry, car donation program, and financial assistance [1][4]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, maintaining a specific policy to distribute funds to those in need within the local community [2].
